website_summaries.verdict: This desktop WiFi extender is simple and reliable, but it can overheat when lying down.
pros: Extends dual-band WiFi up to 1,200 Mbps
Little to no reduction in WiFi speed
Setup instructions are easy to follow
cons: The extender can get very warm when lying down horizontally

customer_reviews.title: ... now in our RV and it has always been easy to use and set up at different locations we ...
customer_reviews.text: Have used this for over a year now in our RV and it has always been easy to use and set up at different locations we move to.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating experience
customer_reviews.text: I spent way too many hours trying to get this configured but failed. I have experience with networks so it is not like I was stumbling around. It is very frustrating that a "new" and out of the box product would be nearly impossible to configure without soliciting the assistance of tech support. I tried everything including disabling the IPv6 which they recommended...........REALLY? Talk about regressing rather than progressing with technology. I couldn't even log onto the extender to do a firmware patch via wireless or wired. I am sending this back and will look for other alternatives to enhance my wifi.
customer_reviews.author: PBW

customer_reviews.title: Achieve PS3 / PS4 40+ Mbps Downloads
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to solve the horrible download speeds that have always plagued the Playstation 3 and 4 when connecting via WiFi. Until I purchased this, the best I'd managed was running a proxy server on my desktop computer and connecting through that for speeds of 4.2 Mbps. This wireless bridge arrived today. I set it up in five minutes for both my 2.4 GHz and 5GHz home WiFi networks. I plugged in both Playstations to the ethernet ports and am finally getting download speeds of 40+ Mbps. These gaming consoles are finally working the way they've always supposed to have been. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Matt O

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, High End Extender!
customer_reviews.text: I already have a netgear router, so I decided to get this extender to get better connectivity on the other side of the house. I have it setup to act as a access point, however I wish this could connect to the router to get its internet rather than the wifi. It's sleek, and looks nice so wherever you put it, it looks nothing like a range extender or router. The design is well thought out, as connectivity and internet speeds are more than I could ask for!
customer_reviews.author: Kamil S.

customer_reviews.title: Functional, but Netgear doesn't support
customer_reviews.text: When OSX Mojave came out, the Netgear USB Control Center stopped working. The installer fails to reinstall. And Netgear has done nothing to fix this situation for over seven months. They know about it. They tried to send out a broken, untested fix that took my computer down, and haven't been heard from since (read all about it on the NETGEAR Community forums, just searc for "Netgear USB Control Center and Mac OS Mojave" (Amazon won't let me enter a direct link, of course.) There is nothing to recommend this extender, and the lack of support sends it into the AVOID category.
customer_reviews.author: RicBret

customer_reviews.title: Versatile WIFI extender
customer_reviews.text: Previously I used a 2nd WIFI router and matched name & password info for seemless connectivity when moving from one side of my house to the other. But, I had problems with the 2nd unit losing an IP address or overall connectivity. So, I purchased the NETGEAR AC1200 Wireless WiFi Range Extender. It arrived in new condition and looked fine. - I unpackaged, plugged in, and followed all set up instructions. - The process was relatively easy with no complications - Signal strength was acceptable for the unit and provided the additional coverage needed - I have had no problems with the unit and I am glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Kory

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware! Cheap extender used to sell you expensive security software!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router two years ago and it works ok, sort of.The transfer speed is nowhere near the advertised rate and the range is only about 75 feet, any more than about 50 foot, line of sight, and the transfer speed drops exponentially. Also the extender password is very long, 14 letters and digits. When i tried to change the password it would not allow me to access it without calling Netgear. When I called Netgear they gave me a run around, classic bait and switch, and claimed they could not change my password, or even access my router without first selling me a $$$ security program for my computer! Total BS! This router is headed for the trashcan.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Won't connect with WPS. Don't waste your time.
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't get it to connect. Couldn't find the serial number on the item AT ALL which they require for submitting a ticket. Apparently they don't give any support (except forums) after three months. After entering my information, their website says "Your complimentary technical support expired on (Thee months after purchase!) So after three months if you need support you are SOLI unless you choose to pay to purchase another warranty. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT WITH SUCH BAD SUPPORT AFTER THREE MONTHS!
customer_reviews.author: M3

customer_reviews.title: Works very well and is easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to install and looks good. Works exceptionally well. Has 2G and 5G Channels. Highly recommend this extendor. You can plug it and use as a second Modem or hook it up with Bluetooth and just extend your existing Modem signal. Easy to follow the directions. Set it and forget it 😊 I read some negative reviews from a few who claimed to be computer technitions. If you can read and follow the directions, it takes 5 minutes to set up. Use your computer to set it up.
customer_reviews.author: Dirk Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works great to extend your bandwidth range.
customer_reviews.text: I like this unit. That said when setting it up as an access point Spectrum unplugged the socket. After a computer answered service call they reset the socket. This had nothing to do with NETGEAR or their support which I didn't need to use. Not wanting to repeat the experience, I used the extender option for install instead of "access point". That worked great. Now I can check my phone's Internet access without going on "LTE" from the far side of my garage and even to the back corners of the back yard. I through the years have always been pleased with NETGEAR products.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M

customer_reviews.title: Set up is a nightmare
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product last year. It was very hard to set up, but eventually got it working. Started to have problems a few months ago with it chronically dropping connections. Reset it to factory settings and tried to reconfigure it, and it will not connect no matter what I do. Have followed the directions and FAQs exactly but it will not connect to our modem again. Rather than pay for customer support since it is past 90 days I am throwing it in the trash and buying another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jungle Team

customer_reviews.title: NO SUPPORT
customer_reviews.text: This thing works pretty well but Netgear's support is a total waste of time. I just updated the firmware and there is no longer an option to update for the next firmware update. They have removed the option to update via the internet or it's a bug in the new firmware. I have tried several times to contact their support but they want $$$ and seem to provide NO way for the consumer to report a bug like this. I tried the forum they have and Facebook messenger and got NO, NOT one response! So...no more neatgear products for me! I'm done with them.
customer_reviews.author: FLHTHEMI

customer_reviews.title: This new standard offers better speed, improved reliability
customer_reviews.text: WiFi extender supports the 802.11ac networking standard. This new standard offers better speed, improved reliability, and more range than older WiFi networking standards. You can use your extender to wirelessly connect as many as five Ethernet-enabled devices, such as smart TVs, game consoles, and Blu-ray players, to your WiFi router or access point at gigabit speeds.
customer_reviews.author: MUSTAFA

customer_reviews.title: Constantly needs to be reset
customer_reviews.text: The router needs to be reset constantly. For whatever reason, the signal drops and needs to be reset 2-3 times a day. I thought it was an issue with the first router I ordered, so I sent it back and had it replaced. But the new one has the same issue. With that said, when it's working properly, the wifi connection is great. I have my PS4 connected directly to it via a LAN cable and the download and upload speeds are great. But I wouldn't recommend or buy it again because of it needing to be reset so much. First world problem, sure, but for the brand and price of the router, it should work a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Ramos Jr.

customer_reviews.title: What a piece of crap!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been messing around with this thing for 3 months trying to get it to work properly. Absolutely no help from Netgear although they advertise free 24/7 assistance. (What a joke) Netgear keeps running me around in circles doing the same thing over and over with ABSOLUTELTY NO PROGRESS. Now I can't send this POS back because they ran me out of time on Amazon's return policy!
customer_reviews.author: Philip M

customer_reviews.title: Made my WiFi worse
customer_reviews.text: We tried to install this when we first got it but it didn’t seem to work so we set it aside to try to mess with later. Tried again and couldn’t get it setup. On the 3rd try (3 years later) we finally get it to work but the WiFi is actually worse when we use it. Download speed goals from 45 to 11 using this. And unfortunately we’re outside the warranty And return window of time. Wasted $ on this thing. 😞
customer_reviews.author: Jellybeanjugler

customer_reviews.title: This product did not do what the seller promised. ...
customer_reviews.text: This product did not do what the seller promised. They said the range it would be extended was 900 Ft. on the box it said 100 meters whitch is 330 Ft I am trying to reach my Mothers house which is 110 Ft from my house it won't even reach that far. so I bought an antenna to pull in the signal another piece of junk. I will never buy from this salesmen or from netgear again. The reason I needed to reach my Mom's house is she is 98 years old and I could talk to her and keep an eye on her.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. St James Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Yahoo! EXCELLENT
customer_reviews.text: I've tried so many wifi extenders, none of which worked with my 2015 Dell desktop until my friend and colleague recommended this one. True to her recommendation, I now of lickety-split fast connection!!!
customer_reviews.author: Elissa

customer_reviews.title: Get something else.
customer_reviews.text: Mine worked great for about a year. Then it started acting up.....weak signal, losing connection to the router. After numerous resets, it is unusable. If I am able to get a device to connect, the connection is constantly lost or has really slow data speeds. So now I need to find something to replace it. I would not recommend this extender.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hanford

customer_reviews.title: Works for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I got this to run some crypto currency miners away from my main router. The setup was a little tricky, but ended up working just fine. Even after a new main router upgrade this still works as needed I just needed to point it to the new one. I had a wired printer on this too for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Graff

customer_reviews.title: Not worth a dime!!
customer_reviews.text: I have fought with this extender for weeks trying to figure out what is wrong with my internet. I finally just plugged in my 5 year old extender and as it turns out it is this piece of equipment that is defective. Of course the return button is gone from my purchase history so I guess I am stuck with a very expensive paperweight!! Very disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great When It Works
customer_reviews.text: Drops the signal often. Don't even think about using the ethernet ports on this device. If you do you'll probably be able to connect to your device about 20 percent of the time. The only thing that stay consistently "on" connected to one of the ethernet ports is a LAN cable to security cam that gets constantly pinged through my Synology NAS. If you have a printer that goes into sleep mode, forget it.
customer_reviews.author: Phelps NY Chick

customer_reviews.title: works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: THis unit replaced a Netgear WN2500RPv2 that crapped out after 1.5 years. Compared to that unit, this has better connection to the primary router (also Netgear) and seems to use the Beamforming technology well. We use to get max 78 Mbps transfer rate (as noted on the status page of the range extender), but this new unit connects with 104Mbps. Using CNETs speed test page, we see a definitive speed improvement to correlate with what the status page says. We'll just have to see how long this one lasts. We use it in Fast-Lane mode to maximize throughput FYI.
customer_reviews.author: noob

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for a few weeks, now won't connect to internet
customer_reviews.text: The initial setup went well, things worked as expected. A few weeks later I couldn't get an internet connection through it, tried resetting to factory settings and re-setup, devices can see the extender but can't get to the internet from it. After a lot of searching and seeing how many people have this similar problem I've decided to shop for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Pink Runner

customer_reviews.title: Can't get it to connect
customer_reviews.text: Two very bad days trying to get this thing to work. Using the WPS button on my router just blocked access to internet(I had to call IPS to get router re-set. Can't connect manually because my laptop does not have a WIFI manager. Update...Amazon send me a replacement without me asking and the new one took less than 5 minutes to get up and running. Now I call than customer service. Thank you Amazon. Got an e-mail to return the bad unit...but I also have an e-mail from Amazon customer service telling me I do not need to return the bad unit. Amazon, you need to get your heads together...........what do I do now????????
customer_reviews.author: Edmon Blocker

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR EVERYTHING BUT GAMING!!
customer_reviews.text: this booster works great to extend your wifi's reach but if you're looking to use the booster for gaming look elsewhere. like i said it gives you a good boost so you do have a better signal but the device randomly cuts off or looses the signal causing massive packet loss thus kicking you out of your game. very disappointing as i mainly bought this extender for gaming since i am across the house from my modem.
customer_reviews.author: Lucia Garcia Designs

customer_reviews.title: So far so good....
customer_reviews.text: I've only had the extended for several days, and at one point lost the signal on it briefly even though the main server did not. It's very easy to set up, and assigns an extension to your main servers name so that you have two separate connections with the main server password for both. Guess we'll see over time if I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Dead after one year
customer_reviews.text: Dead in a little over a year. When it works it's great: strong signal, good design, good software. But then for days at a time, it will continuously drop signals, cycle ethernet, fail to serve sites, etc. Firmware updates, reboots, factory settings, etc, nothing makes a difference. Then it will work for a few days, and then die again.
customer_reviews.author: A. Dremeaux

customer_reviews.title: Works to boost signal.
customer_reviews.text: I just got it today. Setup was easy and it has boosted signal. It shows amber, so not the best reception, but doing a speed test show double performance. My phone shows better reception on this with 2.5 GHZ but good reception with both. Truth is I don't understand difference between 2.5 or 5 ghz. I don't know if the lights in front are supposed to go out, but they do. Now, a day later the lights have turned green.
customer_reviews.author: CarolRo

customer_reviews.title: Very Versitile
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box setup a lityle tricky. Bestcto use the web page portal. Lots of options! After much experimenting I found he best option for me was to "extend" only one band of a dual-band wireless router thwt was at one end of our condo. Testing proved that broadcasting the 2.5 MhZ signal to the range extender and having that signal re- broadcast to my desktop pc at 5.0 MhZ was super efficient. The small booklet explains (somewhat) how to do this very cleaver "trick" to maximize bandwidth efficiency. I'm deducting 1 star for poor instructions
customer_reviews.author: Stanton

customer_reviews.title: Great extender
customer_reviews.text: I recommend doing the install manually instead of using the wps buttons I tried that first and it only extended the 2.4 band, after reseting the extender it was very easy to set up and works great. I now have 2,4 and 5 g in a detached garage about 50 feet and two walls away from the original router. Great product and a nice price. Definatly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Jery Zuko

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT WITH THE RIGHT SETUP!
customer_reviews.text: Added this to a larger house to extend wireless signal and improve quality of the signal. The first setup I tried was to just use it as a wireless extender and it worked ok. What I recently did was run a cable from the router directly to the Netgear AC1200 and WOW what a difference. After a month I not only had better wifi coverage but my cellular data useage was cut in half since now the 5 iPhones in the house stay on the wifi when used at home. Great product with the right setup!
customer_reviews.author: Mark C.

customer_reviews.title: A good brand.
customer_reviews.text: While I'm not able to place the unit in a more advantage area, the extra coverage area is barely noticed. Update 07-06-18. I finally got the opportunity to place this range extender toward the limits of the original signal that was still good in connection reliability. The extended range is significant but falls a bit short of the original signal, AT&T Wi-Fi router. Going thru glass and walls appears to be tough for Wi-Fi. Changed rating from 3 to 4.
customer_reviews.author: ntaguchi

customer_reviews.title: Poor choice
customer_reviews.text: I have had this extender for two years. After the first year it started to drop the 2 GHz channel on a regular basis which required a reboot to fix. The 5 GHz channel is more reliable but still will drop every two weeks or so. I've upgraded the firmware and made sure that the router signal was strong to the extender. The features and ease of use get good grades but the overall stability has been very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: TJF

customer_reviews.title: Updated firmware one day after many days of successfully using ...
customer_reviews.text: Updated firmware one day after many days of successfully using it, and it has become a headache. It will no longer allow me to access the i.p address of the router to get to the settings page. It just keeps asking me to create an account, which I can't do because after pressing next, it starts over from the beginning for no reason. Tried in 4 different internet browsers. In addition, Netgear won't help because I have to pay for support after a year. Thanks Netgear.
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: Does not play well with Apple Airport Extreme 802.11AC
customer_reviews.text: Causes the Apple Airport Extreme 802.11ac to continually reboot...endlessly. When extending an Apple Airport Extreme (Latest Gerenation 802.11ac) it causes that Airport Extreme to endlessly disconnect and reconnect with its status light changing from yellow to green on 15 second intervals. Resetting and reconfiguring AC1200 does not stop this. Unplugging and leaving AC1200 unplugged is the only solution. ALSO: Cannot extend both the main and the Apple Airport Extreme guest SSIDs. It is limited to a single SSID. Was not able to see the Apple 5GHz signal although it could see the 2.4 GHz. In short: Not suitable for Apple Airport Extreme environments. Too many problems. Sending back.
customer_reviews.author: Intelligentsia

customer_reviews.title: Excellent WIFI Extender
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I bought this extender because I moved my internet set-up to my basement inside a closet. While the basement has an excellent signal, my second floor and bedroom off to one side of my house, had a very weak signal. I bought this and placed this right about the center of my house and so far, have been very pleased. Setup is a breeze, just put it within range of your existing router and then move it wherever you need. One thing to note is this does require power so make sure where you intend to put it, there is an outlet. Signal strength is very good and I have had zero issues.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Bossi

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised to extend wifi signal
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't entirely sure that this product would do what we wanted, namely extend our wifi from one end of the house to the other and outside. But it did so perfectly. It was very easy to set up, and we get a good wifi signal clear to the end of the backyard. Great for Zoom meetings with friends and family!
customer_reviews.author: David Lindstedt

customer_reviews.title: Fairly unreliable
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it works great, but more often than not it will just cut out even though the status indicators on the unit claim to have full signal. Devices will connect to it but all pages will just time-out. Problem is solved by unplugging and restarting the unit but I rarely even keep the thing plugged in at this point. Not as impressed with the distance range as I had hoped for, as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommend
customer_reviews.text: This “extender” is about 30 ft from my router but continually loses the signal. It is very difficult to reconnect and when I call service for help they want $89 for 6 mo. coverage. I only pd. $89 for the device to begin with (although they have now dropped the price). I have had nothing but trouble since I bought this. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Morfei

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time or money if you expect a reliable connection
customer_reviews.text: Complete garbage. Before you purchase device, google "netgear ex6200 dropping connection". I should have done more research first. With great signal levels (-55 dB) this drops connection to end-devices every few minutes. I've had 4 cells phones/tablets within a few feet of each other and had one drop at a time while the others remained error few for several minutes. Testing tools show it drops for nearly 30 seconds before returning without any intervention.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Andersen

customer_reviews.title: Works Great with HDTV but read the instructions.
customer_reviews.text: Netgear is the best. Works great when paired with my R7000 Nighthawk flawlessly connecting to my home theater delivering NETFLIXS for the first time over my slow cheap internet provider @ <1.5Mb connection which often runs at half that speed.Watch entire TV series often with maybe one reload to continue viewing. Bought this to support my desire for internet entertainment videos like NETFLIX, HULU and U-TUBE. Alway read the latest reviews, complaints are often a review of not understanding the product. Checking for software updates is a must and reading the directions plus familiarizing yourself with the equipment should not be overlooked.
customer_reviews.author: Bluespark

customer_reviews.title: Problem
customer_reviews.text: I've had slow internet issues for months. I ignored the problem until the holidays when my grown children were home. The cable co checked everything and made adjustments. I purchased the newest Netgear router and it was better, but 17 mps was the best this extender could deliver - with the new laptop, newest router and this extender ALL in the same room. I'm finally convinced the problem is this extender and it is too late to return! I'm sure it is a great extender, I guess mine is defective. UPDATE After several calls and trial and error troublshooting - Netgear determined that my Extender was defective and they are exchanging the extender!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Groom

customer_reviews.title: Disconnecting all the time...Used for Gaming Purposes.
customer_reviews.text: This Extender did not work. It was constantly disconnecting me from the game I was trying to play WoW to be exact. I was getting disconnected frequently. I tried all sorts of different setting options inside the extender configuration options. Fast Lane Option Etc even the Ethernet option and still disconnected all the time. Do not waste your time or your money.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Works well in simplified environments
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure for the average user, this is a perfectly fine device. I'm in the IT industry and utilize virtualization a lot. When extending your network with this device, virtual machines either completely fail to acquire a DHCP address or if they do get an address, it is never successfully renewed. Unfortunately, the "feature" that allows this isn't well documented and is impossible to know in advance when shopping for similar devices. I've tried to find firmware replacements and just can't get this device to work well in my specialized environment.
customer_reviews.author: Flash Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Great WiFi extender once you get it set up
customer_reviews.text: This WiFi extender is really fantastic. It took a little while to get my 5G connection to transmit, but once that was set up it’s been smooth sailing. The connection is really strong throughout my house now and it’s made video streaming perform much better than before. The box is also very compact and fits easily under my TV where it’s easy to hide while still being able to read the lights on the front to validate the connection status. The ability to hard-wire devices in was also surprisingly helpful and made our WiFi cable box perform much better with no lag. Definitely better than a standard wall-plug extender, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Zeidman

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: Update the firmware, after that 110 mbps in WiFi (wired inbound connection) ... this thing is perfect. My main router is a AC-1750 and it’s a perfect compliment. I had to disconnect it from the 1750’s Ethernet cable to be able to login into the domain name of broadcasts. After that it was a super easy setup.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: VERY SLOW
customer_reviews.text: Gets the signal out but 30X slower than regular wi fi connection Others that just plug into outlet didn't work at all
customer_reviews.author: WisconsinPat

customer_reviews.title: Better than anticipated
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup. I used the app to set up as a wired repeater. I was expecting the process of adding an extender to be painful... reallllyy painful. I attempted to do one a long time ago and gave up. This one was very simple. I now get wired/wireless signal in my basement (man cave). Speeds are great. I get the same speeds from the extender as the one it is powered from. (~140mps). If you are looking for an easy extension and want a hard wired connection, get this one.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I was visiting my sister who is somewhat technically challenged. Her complaint has been for years that her house is just too big! I had suggested several times to her that she try a product like this but it overwhelmed her and her husband. So during a recent visit,. I went on line to Amazon dot com, ordered one, and it was delivered almost instatnly! I had it up and running within a couple of hours. Sometimes networking can get complicated for a non professional but I had no difficulty at all with this and I strongly recommend it to anyone who is having trouble getting good connectivity in a difficult (meaning large and with non electromagnetically transparent walls) environment.
customer_reviews.author: David C Steere

customer_reviews.title: Works steadily, but can be a little tricky at first. - Used as an extender.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as an extender. Works wonderfully for me, but there were some hangups at first. No real cons with the device, it can just take some fidgeting here and there to get everything running smoothly for the first couple of days. The main router is at the complete opposite end of the house, and the extender picks up and strengthens my signal to full bars. I've also been hardwiring my devices for a more stable connection and that's been a breeze. Maybe plan on having a couple of days to tweak before fully relying on this device.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy, 2 units neither work
customer_reviews.text: Had it for two days and then the 2.4 channel stopped allowing connections. Troubleshot if for a couple hours doing several resets, updated firmware and went through all the settings. Im using it with a Netgear nighthawk router. I'm a network administrator by profession, and know what I am doing. Finally sent it back and got a replacement. Now after 2 months the replacement is doing the same thing. Avoid this product. Dont buy referbished to save a few bucks. It will cost you in the end. I've had it too long now to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product Did not work
customer_reviews.text: After spending several hours trying to get the device to work we then spent nearly two hours on the phone with tech support. After all that they said it is likely an internal issue with the product so we will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B.

customer_reviews.title: Outdated product
customer_reviews.text: The extender would not connect to my router. When I called Netgear support, they informed me that the product was an older product and that I would need to submit my receipt from Amazon and then wait up to 48 hours before they could help with the product. The Amazon tech support technician was very difficult to understand and his resolution was to send me the product's owner's manual. With all the red tape and frustration of not getting help with the product, I returned it to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Willis

customer_reviews.title: Works great with the NETGEAR Wireless Router, 80-90 MBPS speeds for WiFi
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to extend the range of the Linksys E2500 (N600) Advanced Simultaneous Dual-Band Wireless-N Router I had. The installation and setup between the 2 is a mess. Also, getting back to the setup menu of the extender can be tricky. After endless trials I gave up and ordered the NETGEAR Wireless Router - N900 Dual Band Gigabit (WNDR4500v1) to replace the Linksys, and WOW. IPV4 & IPV6 compatible too. My Wifi speeds went to 80-90 MBPS. It works seamlessly with the Netgear Router and it automatically configured. Works very well with the Netgear Family. Did not work well with the Linksys.
customer_reviews.author: Adim

customer_reviews.title: No customer service
customer_reviews.text: tells you you have a 1 year warranty then says it passed after only 3 months, spent an hour on tech support an hour with amazon mostly on hold saying netgear won't o\honor warranty
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy this product if your far from your router.
customer_reviews.text: This product gave me so much trouble for so long. The range is terrible. Its been about 9 months since i bought this product and the amount of times i had to reconnect it back to the router and connect the router to my devices is beyond me. I had to shift and place it in weird spots for it too work for two weeks before disconnecting. Im a teen who’s unemployed So i was stuck with this one no matter how i put it. Its kinda sad that i had to get long ethernet cables for it work with my devices.
customer_reviews.author: Diandre Tucker

customer_reviews.title: 2500 sqare foot townhouse and needed to extend the range (a bit disappointed that the Nighthawk's range didn't cover the basemen
customer_reviews.text: Bought this extender to improve coverage in the basement of my townhouse. I use a NETGEAR Nighthawk AC1900 Dual Band Wi-Fi Gigabit Router (R7000) in the main floor of my 3-level approx. 2500 sqare foot townhouse and needed to extend the range (a bit disappointed that the Nighthawk's range didn't cover the basement, even after moving it around to optimize coverage (extends well upstairs, but not in the basement). The AC1200 was very easy to install and setup using Netgar Genie. I currently have my laptop connected to the AC1200 via Ethernet cable to maximize the signal. Very pleased overall and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: R. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Hate to say this but it is not working very good for my installation
customer_reviews.text: Losing a lot of my texting and not receiving phone calls I live in a 1480 square-foot house which I should get better coverage but still do not what I recommend this anyone else know I believe I’ll be sending mine back
customer_reviews.author: Bart S.

customer_reviews.title: Need to Extend The Range of WIFi? Look no more!
customer_reviews.text: Want fast WiFi then get this! This has been great to have, it has boosted and improved our WiFi in our basement apartment to full bars. Before this adapter was paired with ASUS Dual-Band Wireless-AC1900 PCI-E Adapter (PCE-AC68) the internet was bad and at 2 bars out of 5, now with this set up and this adapter in my system it has been maxed out! This has been the best solution I could find other then a wired connection which we can not do in the basement apartment. All our devices work great with this and the internet quality and speed has been increased by double. I have loved having this!!
customer_reviews.author: NorkDorf

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: During the covid pandemic my signal became very weak for some reason. A neighbor told me about this product so I purchased. It has really helped! But still can’t get service in our shop. But at least the signal is good everywhere in the house!
customer_reviews.author: Coleen Goodner

customer_reviews.title: It actually gives better reception than what the cable company supplied
customer_reviews.text: this works very well. It actually gives better reception than what the cable company supplied. One drawback is that when you connect this to your existing wifi, it is listed as a separate entity, such as wifi123_2gext and wifi123_5gext. My device automatically connects to this when I am close and its signal is stronger, but it will not connect back to the main wifi when it is stronger. I have to do that manually when I realize I have poor wifi, or if I remember when I get there. Otherwise it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: The Possum

customer_reviews.title: Does what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Definitely boosts the signal and allowed me to set up a home office wirelessly. As an example of how well this has worked in my house, I recently disconnected and realized I was have trouble streaming video content on our main TV. Hooked this back up and problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: Set it and forget it - it works.
customer_reviews.text: My laptop was struggling to connect to the main router from my bedroom, and this baby did the trick! I think that's pretty much sums it up. Very simple and effective solution to weak WiFi signal. A little expensive, but I'd rather pay this amount and have it work than to fight my router. I have had to reset my main router occasionally (once every 2 months or so), but I'm pretty sure I've had to do that for all routers that I've used in the past 10 years. The Netgear has never been the problem, so I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Pathik

customer_reviews.title: Changed the WiFi Usability in Our House Instantly!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this can't be beat. I spent a ton of time searching for a solid extender because my router wasn't cutting in a 2-story house. Adding this extender on the other floor changed the usability of the Internet in our house in an instant. Setup is easy. Although, I did have to manually add the 5.8GHz channel, the auto sync with my Linksys rounter worked perfectly for the 2.4GHz channel. Adding the 5.8GHz channel wasn't hard because the setup UI is so well laid out. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: E. Reagan

customer_reviews.title: Slow download speed
customer_reviews.text: Signal is strong but download speed is extremely slow for me. I had moved extender closer to router with not much improvement. I bought this product after reading good reviews here and recommendation from popular consumer website. If you have a bigger house, I recommend Hawking instead. Speedtest show 30x faster download speed for my set up using my older extender. On the plus side, this netgear extender is a breeze to set up even for novice user . I was not able to utilize the fastlane technology which may improve performance since 5g is not supported by my router.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: After wrestling with my Smart TV and being unable to access its internet features
customer_reviews.text: The configuration of my house made it almost impossible for us to watch TV in any room other than the living room. After wrestling with my Smart TV and being unable to access its internet features, my cable company suggested that we buy a wi-fi extender. My husband did extensive research on the ones available in the market, and we bought this one. Well, it's working like a charm! No more problems with my smartphone, android tablet or TV in any room in the house. And BTW, this wasn't the most expensive but it's a work horse and truly worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Reliable Shopper

customer_reviews.title: WARNING!
customer_reviews.text: After a firmware update, the EX6200 wouldn't provide an admin-login screen, even after I tried all the Netgear-suggested workarounds. Searching the web, I discovered that this was a common problem, causing great user frustration. After managing to find the secret Netgear support number, I was told I would get no support until I paid for a support contract. (That left me with an unusable product, and with the feeling that I would never again buy another Netgear product.)
customer_reviews.author: Reed White

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine out of the box, however, WIFI gave out 1 day after the Amazon return policy time frame "Return window closed on Jan 31, 2017". So, now I have to get with customer service at Netgear. I have no idea what happened, the router shows up on my phones and laptops, it just wont connect; the wired ports work fine which I tested with my laptop. I can not access router config page wired directly to extender through IP or MYWIFI.NET. Factory reset had the same results. I was pleased with this product for 30 days. After following all troubleshooting guides, I'm afraid I ended up with a wired router.
customer_reviews.author: Chief Swabbee

customer_reviews.title: Extender works, but at 1/3 of the speeds from your router.
customer_reviews.text: Extends yes. What they don't tell you is that you only get 1/3 of your wireless bandwidth with this. I have the router on the third floor of my house and when testing the signal coming from my Asus Black Knight sitting on the third floor it's full strength. When I connect to the extender on the same floor to test, I get 1/3 of the download speeds and about a half of the upload speeds. I called Netgear to ask them about this, and they informed me that you will ONLY get 1/3 of the speeds from your router with this product. It's up to you to decide if the extended range is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan M

customer_reviews.title: Ease of Hookup
customer_reviews.text: Range extender functions as advertised. Range extender was used to over come COX slowing down the network speeds as night. Placed the unit directly in front of my TABLO Quad and the buffeting disappeared.
customer_reviews.author: 2cats

customer_reviews.title: Signal good for internet use in outbuilding now
customer_reviews.text: Significant boost to Wi-Fi. I live in a stone house with walls about 2.5 feet thick. Due to placement of wifi terminal during installation, signal strength to porches and outbuilding weak: Kindle connections to Amazon routinely dropped, for example. Installed AC1200 in window of second story room where wifi modem located and now can spend hundreds of dollars on books without hindrance. Signal good for internet use in outbuilding now. I am only using it as a simple repeater and lower speed bracket, so cannot speak to all features. Easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: S. M.Silver

customer_reviews.title: Good product very poor support
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good range extender, but one that had me working with Netgear support for almost 4 hours. The most frustrating part of the process is the folks in India could have taken control of my computer and quickly resolved the issue. What they did was try to get me to sign up for a 2 year service contract before they would take control of my computer. I refused to be held for ransom to have a process fixed that was the result of less than good documentation. In the end I found the solution to the problem on my own.. No more Netgear products for me.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: OK. Has some problems. Tech support is a joke.
customer_reviews.text: ok. paired with a netgear N750 dual band router. consistently drops one of two bands over a period of 2 to 4 days, causing need to reboot router. not positive if this is router or extender problem, but the router is less than a year old and I have no problems when using band from router instead of extender. Updated 11/9/14 - Please see my reply to Netgear's reply below. Maybe their responses on Amazon are automated and tech support does not exist. Just a thought. This product drops channels so often, especially using their Fastlane Technology, that it is just a paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Richard B

customer_reviews.title: Still doesn't get through walls any better than the original
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't have the range I had hoped for, but it is definitely an improvement over the existing access point. If I put this one right next to the old one, it extends about 25-35% farther. Still doesn't get through walls any better than the original, which is what I was hoping for. Set up is easy, a little too easy... you can't modify very much beyond basic set up. No advanced options.
customer_reviews.author: Customer #42A

customer_reviews.title: Didn't meet my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I'm disappointed with it. I replaced an older cheaper one that had worked fine for many years. This one has too many options for the uninitiated. The signal range is short. The extended 2g drops out a lot. Browsing just stops even though signal level is fairly constant. Would be nice if someone merely made one of these things that could be setup simply without all the tech speak and high learning curve.
customer_reviews.author: azureglow

customer_reviews.title: Great item.
customer_reviews.text: Great item...my router is actually about 75 feet away in a different house and I have it so can get a wifi signal in my house...has no problem picking up signal and gives good coverage through my home which is a house trailer...setup was a breeze, the extender keeps my TV, ps3, tablet, media streaming player, 2 smart phones, my son's tablet and any visitor's phones connected to the internet while here...I would recommend both the seller and the product at anytime to anyone who is wanting to purchase one.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase!  Very Please!
customer_reviews.text: This was a good purchase. I bought this to replace a Netgear WN3000RP Extender that we've had for quite some time. It's capabilities were limited and it dropped it's connection daily. This new AC1200 is a quantum leap over the old WN3000. The broadcast range is twice that of the old one and it supports much greater bandwidth. My iPad connected through this extender is seeing 50MB + download speed on the speedtest app! Also, with WPN support, setup is nearly a pushbutton process! Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Treibs

customer_reviews.title: I have (finally) become convinced of the futility of this effort and that these are nothing more than (expensive) empty boxes wi
customer_reviews.text: This is the fourth extender I have purchased ... on the failed assumption that if I keep buying increasingly more expensive extenders, sooner or later, one of them will work. I have (finally) become convinced of the futility of this effort and that these are nothing more than (expensive) empty boxes with pretty flashing lights. This one (I believe) linked to my router, but none of my devices would link to it. Very frustrating ... not to mention, very expensive. On its way back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: PSebelist

customer_reviews.title: I know that Netgear is a good company and they make a great product but for ...
customer_reviews.text: I know that Netgear is a good company and they make a great product but for some reason I just could not get this range extender to work properly in my home. It kept dropping the connection. Thus, I had to return it. Thank you Amazon for allowing me to do so. I must say that the unit looks awesome! It looked very nice on my desk as compared the competitors unit which I am currently using.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Buyer

customer_reviews.title: The EX6200 is much better than the EX6100
customer_reviews.text: I've used both the EX6100 and the EX6200 as access points. The EX6200 is much better than the EX6100, which has a very poor range. Both work well and as advertised and set-up is a breeze, but if you have to have devices so close to the router for it work well, it kind of defeats the purpose of Wi-Fi. Definitely go with the EX6200, it's great and can even been reworked with DD-WRT into a nice, full-featured router if you ever want to play with that.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Craven

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I went through other range extenders before finding one that worked. Started out in the $30 range and wound up with this one in the $80 range. But it works.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel E. Hofford

customer_reviews.title: Too bad
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install but when using internet cuts off way to much
customer_reviews.author: Hunter Harris

customer_reviews.title: Saved the Summer!!!
customer_reviews.text: This item has saves the day! I have a brick hone and .y Internet signal was extremely weak outside (I have an AC router already). I purchased this and my Internet is blazing fast almost everywhere, including my entire back yard. Set up was easy for 2.4, but the 5 was a little tricky. The directions were barely acceptable for anything more than 2G coverage. Even online wasn't very helpful. The link provided online did not take me where it said. I finally figures it out. But even with the trouble I cannot complain. Great device. PC Mag gives great reviews and they were not wrong.
customer_reviews.author: DizzyDeziC

customer_reviews.title: How much has my range been extended?
customer_reviews.text: works but not as good as I thought. My laptop can show up to 144 mbps but doesn't most of the time. Although placed only 15 feet from the unit the speed can be very slow or very fast but inconsistent. There is a wall that partially obscures line of sight but you would think that it wouldn't matter because the distance is so small between devices. Called Netgear and they were helpful but I am reporting my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Skyken

customer_reviews.title: setup was easy (in my case because WPS was available)
customer_reviews.text: Woirks, setup was easy (in my case because WPS was available), WiFi range is better. But gave up on telephone support after 20 minutes and chat support lacked knowledge. There is no Analytics app for iOS (because of Apple) so you're on your own to find a third party app. The signal lights are dim and the labels hidden. There is a bright corporate logo light that glares in the night. This is the only consumer product I've ever run across that has a lighted corporate logo. That cost a star in my rating.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Taft

customer_reviews.title: Works well, quick shipping
customer_reviews.text: I recieved this with a refurb'd Netgear 6700 router and had several issues. Problem was not with the AC1200 but with the 6700 refurb unit. After several days of Tx I finally bought another router, this time a TPLink AC1700 which works very well alone and with the Netgear AC1200. I use the AC1200 to connect in 5GHz to my TPLink router. The AC1200 then supplies hardwired LAN connections to my entertainment center devices. The connection is quick and I've had no issues with XBox Live, Netflix, Hulu or YouTube while streaming through this box. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin T.

customer_reviews.title: Tops in it's class!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, flawless, simple 245 second installation. Using as a bridge for my new and improved Amazon Fire TV. My Apple Time Machine Dual Band Router is buried somewhere upstairs in an office. I now have excellent signals on two bands, fast and reliable on two floors. If you read the reviews out there, this thing consistently is a number one pick. Powerful, loaded with features and not bad looking if you can't hide it. Thanks for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: BergyPhx

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: This NETGEAR unit replaced an older CISCO unit and is a great improvement, very easy to install and it works straight out of the box and the range is wonderful
customer_reviews.author: Au-Met

customer_reviews.title: Picked Up Many Channels!!
customer_reviews.text: We use this in our camper. We picked up several channels. You have to do a reset up every new place you go. So have to scan you smart tv every time. The text support is on line. You have to look on line about info.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Goodhope

customer_reviews.title: Best extender we've had so far
customer_reviews.text: Has lasted almost a year so far and I don't think we have ever had to re-start it. Connection was really simple with our router. I would go with 5 stars, but the range isn't tremendous and the signal fluctuates. But since we use it to reach our back patio it has to go through a wall. Near the house it strong, but you can't get too far away before the signal degrades pretty quickly. Inside the house it reaches pretty well, but still spotty in our bedroom which is on the opposite side of the house (about 40 feet from the extender).
customer_reviews.author: Sooner in Texas

customer_reviews.title: It works now.
customer_reviews.text: It works now. I was one of the unlucky ones. Where some have a 60 second setup, mine took an hour and a half. Turns out that if you have a router that isn't broadcasting at 5 GHz you aren't able to skip that step in the install process. I needed to update the firmware to solve my install problems. If I hadn't read online what to do from others who have had the same problem I'd have been left with a $100 paperweight. I expected a smoother process for the pricetag.
customer_reviews.author: Magic Door Bookshop

customer_reviews.title: great wifi
customer_reviews.text: as soon as I hooked up this, the wifi in my room spiked up. I barely had any wifi in my up stairs bedroom. Now, I have full strength wifi.... this is great
customer_reviews.author: Steele

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't get the extender to use my router password.
customer_reviews.text: Purchase this and connected to my router using the WPS buttons on the router and extender. When I tried to login with the router password I kept getting a password mismatch. Spent 1 and 1/2 hours on phone with netgear support without a resolution. Tried hard resetting of both the router and extender but still kept getting the password mismatch. Finally gave up and am back to using the router without the extender. I will be sending the unit back to Amazon. See my new reponse
customer_reviews.author: Robert S.

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I had quite a bit of trouble setting this up, but have to assume it was the fault of my sketchy Internet service. Once I got it going, seems to work very well. Good instructions and suggestions.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie  H.

customer_reviews.title: Great choice for WiFi extension
customer_reviews.text: This thing performs better than I had expected. I bought this thing for gaming and it performs great. I’m able to download games at solid speeds and my connection in game has been stable throughout my experience. My WiFi router is on my ground floor and the extender was on the second so the range is solid as well. If you want a WiFi extender that is reliable this is a solid choice. My only gripe if any would be the length of the power cable. It’s not a dealbreaker nor a serious problem but I think an extra foot would go a long way.
customer_reviews.author: David Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Look for others..
customer_reviews.text: Big disappointment. Died an unexplainable death about 4 months after purchase and signal before that was spotty and surprisingly weak. Have no idea why it gets good reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Richard London

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for a wider area wifi network
customer_reviews.text: There were some growing pains getting our wifi network setup right with optimal signal strength. The key is location location location. We had issues at first where we kept losing the main router connection. Later I diagnosed it to be the router did not have a good enough output and out read only single band. I highly recommend using a dual band router with this extender, it is well with it. I ended up using the Netgear AC 1750. Then once I found the perfect spot for the extender we have had nothing but very fast, strong wifi signal. On 5G we are getting 40-50Mbps Everytime.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond John nichols

customer_reviews.title: It is overkill? Maybe but I love overkill !!!
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to extend my connection so I could sit on the back deck and have Internet access. This extender has achieved this and more. I can stream UHD over at my neighbors across the road. I wonder how far it will go? I am going for a walk to find out. I read a tech tester streamed UHD 68 ft away. Definitely configure fastlaneTM as I have 30mbs in extra speed when connecting to the extender. I will have to go and reconfigure my router now lol.
customer_reviews.author: Azman

customer_reviews.title: Garbage and no support, never again will I buy Netgear
customer_reviews.text: Failed at 3 1/2 months, guess how long you get support? Not over 90 days. Netgear wants you to pay them to tell you why their unit isn't working, Last NetGear product I buy ever
customer_reviews.author: John L. Ratcliffe

product_meta.title: NETGEAR AC1200 Wireless WiFi Range Extender (EX6200)
product_meta.description: Model:AC1200 DesktopNETGEAR AC1200 High Power 700mW Dual band Wi Fi Range Extender Desktop with 5 Ports (EX6200)
feature_bullets: Range extenders eliminate dead zones and improves WiFi coverage in your home
NETGEAR extenders are easy to set up with the push of a button or mobile responsive User Interface

Combined speeds up to 1.2 Gbps (AC1200) for fast, reliable connections. Dual Band Extends 2.4 and 5 GHz WiFi signals from existing WiFi routers for better range, DLNA compatible Digital Media Server(DMS)
Universal compatibility to easily extend your current WiFi with your existing gateway, router, or ISP provided gateway
Connect wired devices like smart TVs and game consoles to the 5 Gigabit Ethernet Ports

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars14,388 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
